intro: Microstylis fulva, commonly known as the yellow microstylis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in dense clusters. It typically grows in wet, marshy environments and is often found in swampy areas or along the edges of ponds. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically important species.
